intro: Pedicularis subrostrata, commonly known as the rostrated lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in alpine environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils at high elevations. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
